description: The `synthetic.course_sections` table represents individual sections of courses offered, detailing information such as the section number, term, and associated instructor. It likely depends on foreign keys for course, term, instructor, and potentially room relationships, although these relationships are unspecified. The table tracks each section's enrollment details, scheduling, and status, serving a crucial role in managing class offerings and logistics within the educational data model.

columns.name: section_id
columns.description: This column represents a uniquely assigned identifier for each course section within the table. It ensures each section can be individually referenced.

columns.name: course_id
columns.description: This column represents the unique identifier for different course sections, indicating which section a course belongs to. The values suggest a variety of course offerings without specifying the exact courses.

columns.name: section_number
columns.description: This column likely represents unique identifiers for course sections. Purpose unclear from available data, as the values do not suggest a specific pattern or categorization.

columns.name: term_id
columns.description: This column identifies the term during which a course section is offered, represented by a unique numeric identifier. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: instructor_id
columns.description: This column identifies the individual responsible for teaching or leading a specific course section by assigning a unique numerical identifier to each instructor. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: max_enrollment
columns.description: This column represents the maximum number of students allowed to enroll in a particular course section, indicating the capacity limit for each course offering. The values suggest varying enrollment limits across different sections, ranging from very small to large capacities.

columns.name: current_enrollment
columns.description: This column represents the number of students currently enrolled in a specific course section. The values indicate varying enrollment levels, suggesting a range of class sizes.

columns.name: status
columns.description: Indicates the current operational state of course sections, such as whether a section is currently active, pending, or inactive. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a course section was created. The purpose is to track the creation timestamp of entries in the course_sections table.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column indicates the last time a record in the course_sections table was modified, recorded in a timestamp format. The exact purpose of this data is unclear from the available information.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX course_sections_pkey ON synthetic.course_sections USING btree (section_id)
